item.title: Congratulating Jockey Calvin Borel for his victory at the 133rd Kentucky Derby.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

item.title: Honoring the 50th anniversary of the successful demonstration of the first integrated circuit and its impact on the electronics industry.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S6143)

summary.text:
Commends Louisiana jockeys for their continued success in the Kentucky Derby at Churchill Downs.

Recognizes: (1) jockey Calvin Borel for winning the 133rd running of the Kentucky Derby on May 5, 2007; and (2) the achievements of all current and former Louisiana jockeys in the Kentucky Derby.

bill.title: A resolution commending Louisiana jockeys for their continued success in the Kentucky Derby at Churchill Downs.

item.title: A resolution commending Louisiana jockeys for their continued success in the Kentucky Derby at Churchill Downs.
A resolution commending Louisiana jockeys for their continued success in the Kentucky Derby at Churchill Downs.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S6143)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
